channel.title: Webclient Scanner
channel.description:
So I have been studying the Java language and I am here to present the Online Webclient scanner (suggested for scanning private server webclients). For those who know about malware this will come in handy for those who have no clue what a webclient is, this is not for you. Its not an anti-virus all it does is scan a webclient to see if any malicious process tries to execute itself.
Here's the link *
Don't bitch at me because I don't have a domain, if you want to donate feel free to donate you will see my email in the support tab while this scans.

item.title: Webclient Scanner
item.dc:creator: @WiseMen WiseMen
item.description:
@WiseMen wrote:

If it’s a .tk he must be spreading his botnet, and obviously if you have to accept the java thing. It’s a virus.

IF YOU TRY THIS, AND YOU HAVE TO RUN AN APPLICATION - I’D SUGGEST NOT RUNNING IT.

Edit; Yes, if you know what a Java-Driveby is. That’s what it is!
THIS IS A INFECTION FOR A R.A.T; Don’t download it, it’s a .tk (Java-Driveby)

If any mods know what that is, you’ll see that every Java-Drive have same background/format.

It’ll look a-bit like this;
http://img682.imageshack.us/i/minecraft.png/
http://img121.imageshack.us/i/error2a.jpg/

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Scanner
item.dc:creator: @CokeCo CokeCo
item.description:
@CokeCo wrote:

spy man47:

So this scans a webclient if it has viruses, when downloadong Cache??

Smarticle. Your correct. You just need to have this running while the cache is downloading. If it detects something vulnerable it will block the cache from continuing.

Read full topic
